recipes.title: Apple Protein Muffins
recipes.description: Cinnamon-spiced apple protein muffins with fresh apple chunks. 19g protein, 125 calories per muffin. Tastes like apple pie but supports your fitness goals.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Spray a 12-slot muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray or use silicone muffin cups.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, protein powder, and baking powder until well combined to prevent protein clumps.
In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Add the yogurt and egg whites, stirring until uniform.

Gently fold the wet mixture into the dry ingredients—do not overmix. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 350°F for 13-15 more minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Add the yogurt and egg whites, stirring until uniform.

recipes.title: High Fiber Protein Muffins
recipes.description: High fiber protein muffins packed with 8g fiber and 18g protein per serving. Supports digestive health, satiety, and sustained energy throughout the day.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Spray a 12-slot muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray or use silicone muffin cups.
In a large bowl, whisk together the oat flour, protein powder, flaxseed, psyllium husk, chia seeds, and baking powder until well combined.
In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Add the Greek yogurt, egg whites, grated zucchini, and grated carrot. Mix until well combined.

Gently fold the wet mixture into the dry ingredients—do not overmix. Let batter rest for 5 minutes to allow fiber to absorb moisture. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 350°F for 15-18 more minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: High Protein Muffins With Greek Yogurt
recipes.description: High protein muffins featuring Greek yogurt as the star ingredient. Triple duty moisture, protein, and texture enhancement.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Spray a 12-slot muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray or use silicone muffin cups.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, protein powder, and baking powder until well combined to prevent protein clumps.
In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Add the yogurt and egg whites, stirring until uniform.

Gently fold the wet mixture into the dry ingredients—do not overmix. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 350°F for 13-15 more minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: High Protein Muffins Without Protein Powder
recipes.description: High protein muffins without protein powder. Whole food ingredients like cottage cheese, egg whites, and oat flour only. 6g protein per muffin.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Spray a 12-slot muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray or use silicone muffin cups.
In a large bowl, whisk together the oat flour and baking powder until well combined.
In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Blend the cottage cheese until smooth, then add it along with the egg whites, stirring until uniform.

Gently fold the wet mixture into the dry ingredients—do not overmix. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes, then reduce to 350°F for 13-15 more minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: Protein Muffins Recipe
recipes.description: The complete USDA-verified protein muffins recipe. Every ingredient measured in grams for perfect, repeatable results.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Spray a 12-slot muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. We recommend using a silicone tray for the best no-stick release without adding fats.
Whisk the oat flour, vanilla whey protein, baking powder, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Ensuring these are well-distributed prevents protein clumps later.

In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until smooth (use a scale for 300g precision). Stir in the Greek yogurt and egg whites until uniform. Fold the wet mix into the dry mix gently—do NOT overmix or the muffins will become gummy.
Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes, then (without opening the door) lower the heat to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 13-15 more minutes. This creates the bakery-style domed top.
